title.narrative: Zochonis - Improving Maternal Health Services at Bawku Prebyterian Hospital

description.narrative:
The Bawku Presbyterian Hospital is located in the Upper East Region and serves as a major referral centre for Bawku and surrounding communities, some of which are located in Togo and Burkina Faso. The hospital serves an average of 3,000 women annually with reproductive health services inclusing maternal health services. The hospital however faces a major challenge in the delivery of maternal health services due to inadequate equipment. There entire hospital is stocked with just 35 beds which include 3 delivery beds. As if the logistical challenges are not enough, the hospital has only 10 qualified midwives and a single gynaecologist.
In view of all these challenges, the Zochonis Charitable Trust has offered to suport the Bawku Presbyterian Hospital with £60,000 to construct: 1. a labour ward 2. Procure a biochemistry analyser machine 3. Fund Trainee midwifes 4. Procure Ultrasound machine and other relevaant equipment as may be determined by the hospital
These activities are meant to augment the on-going IMPROVE project which is being funded by the EU and scheduled to end in January 2017. The IMPROVE project focuses on empowering citizens to advocate for improved maternal health service delivery.

The activities in this project are geared towards ensuring that majority if not all women who access maternal health services will be comfortable and can be suitably accomodated during labour/delivery.It is hoped that this will serve as an incentive for preganant women to access skilled delivery instead of home deliveries. The training of additional midwives will avail skilled health personnel to render services to the numerous women who use the facilitiy. It is envisioned that the procurement of the hospital equipment such as ultrasound machines and the biochemical analyser will assist with quality health care diagnosis and delivery.
The project is envisioned to reach at least 3,000 women and 10,000 women at most.
